ai4materials.utils.utils_parsing module¶

ai4materials.utils.utils_parsing.get_pymatgen_ase_from_cif_structure(path)[source]¶
ai4materials.utils.utils_parsing.nmd_uri_to_ase_atoms_tmp(nmd_uris, get_energy_total=True, calc_spacegroup=True)[source]¶

Temporary function to build ASE atoms from nmd uri. Will be substituted from the new option in nomad resolve.

ai4materials.utils.utils_parsing.read_atomic_structures(data_folder, nb_max_folders=1000, nb_max_files=10000, filename_suffix='.aims', format_input='aims', calc_spgroup=False, symprec=(0.001, 1e-06, 1e-09))[source]¶

ai4materials.utils.utils_parsing.read_data(json_list, calc_spgroup=True, symprec=0.001)[source]¶

Read json file from the NOMAD Archive format and get a list of ASE structures

ai4materials.utils.utils_parsing.read_gdb_7k(dataset=None, xyz_file=None, target_file=None)[source]¶

Read the gdb_7k dataset.

Link to reference: http://iopscience.iop.org/article/10.1088/1367-2630/15/9/095003/meta;jsessionid=BE06A5911A9B58D271F6E2C145D54FDC.c2.iopscience.cld.iop.org Link to dataset: http://www.mrupp.info/Data/2013dsgdb7njp.zip

Parameters:

dataset: string
File containing the dataset. If taken from the link above, it is named “dsgdb7njp.xyz”.
xyz_file: string, optional, default ./dsgdb7njp_ase.xyz
File containing the configurations in the dataset that can be read by the ASE python library.
target_file: string, optional, default ./dsgdb7njp.csv
CSV file containing the target values as panda dataframe. See the code below for details.

Returns:

dataset: dataframe
Dataframe containing the data read from the datasets. It is 7211 rows.

Code author: Angelo Ziletti <angelo.ziletti@gmail.com>
